answers.answer: It could be a possible uti. Your urine might have small traces of blood in it. I had a uti around 17 weeks and had no symptoms other than a back ache. Might be worth checking out, even just for peace of mind. :)
Maybe it was something you drank, or ur vitamins?!

Food can affect the color of urine, although I don't know that it would be noticeable when wiping. An excess of carrots or sweet potatoes? I about had a heart attack one morning after I ate a lot of beets and my urine was bright red... but if you're that worried call your doctor!

I would mention it to your doctor. I have a cousin who had preeclampsia durning her pregnancy and she was hospitalized and at one point they said her pee was orange. She was having lots of diffrent difficultes and went into labor anddelivered her baby at 35 weeks.I'm not saying that will happen to you at all. I'm not sure what was causing her to have orange pee but I would want my doctor to know if it happened to me. It may have had something to do with her having protein in her urine... but again I'm not sure.Your doctor could give you a lot sounder information than me. Lol
Maybe your dehydrated. That could make your urine a darker color too! Hope nothing to serious. Dehydration made me go into labor at 36 wks with my first pregnancy. Good luck!
I had this not so long ago, drink loads of water and it should go!! it's because your dehydrated

question: So today i noticed my pee was weird looking i'm used to it being darker since I've been pregnant but now its not even that. When I'm wiping i tend to look before i flush in case of blood or anything well today an maybe yesterday I've been wiping an seeing orange an it's starting to worry me if any of you might know if I'm okay or if i should call the emergency room that would be helpfull.
title: orange stuff ?
